page.title: 18WHERE TO SHOP IN WOODINGDEAN
page.content: A typical parade of shops is brick built and about thirty years old. Most are built like houses, with shops at the bottom,and flats or maisonettes above.They are in groups of three or four and change hands frequently. The average number in a parade is twenty. Types of shops are:- A supermarket, garage, bank, newsagent, hairstylist, cafe, woolshop, video-hire, electrical goods, solicitor, greengrocer and two florists. The shops in Woodingdean are mainly used for odds and ends that people forget to buy in the bigger shops in the centre of Brighton.The shops in Woodingdean are often busiest on Saturdays.Old age pensioners are the ones who get their shopping predominately in Woodingdean.
